briefdescription.para: Archives the object into the data message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BMessage object to archive the object into.
Whether or not to archive child views as well.

simplesect.para: A status code, B_OK if everything went well or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BScrollBar object from the data message.

simplesect.para: A newly created scroll bar or NULL if the message doesn't contain an archived BScrollBar object.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been attached to a window.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been detached from a window.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the scroll bar is attached to a window.

detaileddescription.para: This method does nothing, unlike in BeOS R5. In BeOS scroll bars were implemented directly in the App Server, the client BScrollBar was just a proxy which needed to be synced up on AttachedToWindow(). On Haiku, scroll bars are implemented more sanely and thus don't need to do this.
Hook method called when the object is detached from a window.

briefdescription.para: Draws the area of the scroll bar that intersects updateRect.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangular area to be drawn.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the scroll bar is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The point of the top left corner of the frame that the view has been moved to.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the scroll bar is resized.

parameterdescription.para: The new width of the view.
The new height of the view.

briefdescription.para: Handle message received by the associated looper.

detaileddescription.para: Calls ValueChanged() in response to B_VALUE_CHANGED. Scrolls the view in response to B_MOUSE_WHEEL_CHANGED.

parameterdescription.para: The message received by the associated looper.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when a mouse button is pressed.

detaileddescription.para: Begins scrolling the target view in response to a mouse click. If the user clicked the scroll bar thumb this begins scrolling and continues in MouseMoved() ending on MouseUp(). If the user clicked on one of the scroll arrows the view is scrolled a small amount, if the user clicks on an area of the scroll view outside the arrows and thumb the view is scrolled by a larger amount.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is pressed.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when a mouse button is released.

detaileddescription.para: Finishes scrolling and redraws the scroll bar if necessary.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is released.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the mouse is moved.

detaileddescription.para: If the user clicked on the scroll bar thumb the view is scrolled as the user moves the mouse up and down or left and right.

parameterdescription.para: The new location of the mouse in the view's coordinate system.

One of the following:
B_ENTERED_VIEW The cursor has just entered the view.
B_INSIDE_VIEW The cursor is inside the view.
B_EXITED_VIEW The cursor has left the view's bounds. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
B_OUTSIDE_VIEW The cursor is outside the view. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
If a drag-and-drop operation is taking place this is a pointer to a BMessage that holds the drag information, otherwise the pointer is NULL.

detaileddescription.para: Hook method called when the attached window is activated or deactivated.

parameterdescription.para: true when the window becomes activated, false when the window becomes deactivated.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the value of the scroll bar changes.

parameterdescription.para: The new scroll bar value.

briefdescription.para: Reports the suites of messages and specifiers understood by the scroll bar.

detaileddescription.para: Reports the suites of messages and specifiers that derived classes understand.

memberdef.argsstring: (BMessage *message, int32 index, BMessage *specifier, int32 what, const char *property)
memberdef.name: ResolveSpecifier

briefdescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

detaileddescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

parameterdescription.para: The scripting message to determine the handler.
The index of the specifier.
The message which contains the specifier.
The 'what' field of the specifier message.
The name of the target property.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the proper BHandler for the given scripting message.

briefdescription.para: Archive constructor.

parameterdescription.para: The message data to construct the scroll bar from.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, const char *name, BView *target, float min, float max, orientation direction)
memberdef.name: BScrollBar

briefdescription.para: Instantiates a new scroll bar and connects it to the target view.

detaileddescription.para: The frame rectangle defines the location and size of the scroll bar within its parent view. A horizontal scroll bar should be B_H_SCROLL_BAR_HEIGHT pixels high, and a vertical scroll bar should be B_V_SCROLL_BAR_WIDTH pixels wide.

Unlike most BView derived constructors in the Interface Kit this method doesn't provide a resizing mode. Scroll bars are assigned a resizing behavior based on their direction. Horizontal scroll bars resize themselves horizontally (B_FOLLOW_LEFT_RIGHT | B_FOLLOW_BOTTOM) and vertical scroll bars resize themselves vertically (B_FOLLOW_TOP_BOTTOM | B_FOLLOW_RIGHT).

parameterdescription.para: The frame rectangle of the scroll bar.
The name of the scroll bar, can be NULL.
The target view to scroll, can be NULL.
The min scroll value.
The max scroll value.
The scroll direction. Either B_HORIZONTAL or B_VERTICAL.

simplesect.para: SetRange() to set the min and max values.
SetOrientation() to set the scroll bar direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, BView *target, float min, float max, orientation orientation)
memberdef.name: BScrollBar

briefdescription.para: Instantiates a new scroll bar to be used as part of a layout and connects it to the target view.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the scroll bar, can be NULL.
The target view to scroll, can be NULL.
The min scroll value.
The max scroll value.
The scroll direction. Either B_HORIZONTAL or B_VERTICAL.

simplesect.para: SetRange() to set the min and max values.
SetOrientation() to set the scroll bar direction.

briefdescription.para: Destructor method.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes the scroll bar, sets the target to NULL and frees any memory used.

briefdescription.para: Fill out the preferred width and height of the scroll bar into the _width and _height parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes should override this method to set the preferred size of object.

simplesect.para: Either the _width or _height parameter may be set to NULL if you only want to get the other one.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a float to store the width of the view.
Pointer to a float to store the height of the view.

briefdescription.para: Fills out min and max with the minimum and maximum range values.

simplesect.para: Either min or max may be set to NULL if you only want to get the other one.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a float to be filled out with the min value.
A pointer to a float to be filled out with the max value.

briefdescription.para: Fills out smallStop and largeStep with the small and large step values respectively.

simplesect.para: Either smallStep or largeStep may be set to NULL if you only want to get the other one.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a float to be filled out with the small step value.
A pointer to a float to be filled out with the large step value.

briefdescription.para: Makes the scroll bar the current focus view of the window or gives up being the window's focus view.

detaileddescription.para: The focus view handles selections and KeyDown events when the the attached window is active. There can be only one focus view at a time per window.
When called with focus set to true this method first calls MakeFocus() on the previously focused view with focus set to false.

The focus doesn't automatically change when MouseDown() is called so calling MakeFocus() is the only way to make a view the focus view of a window. Classes derived from BView that can display the current selection, or that can accept pasted data should call MakeFocus() in their MouseDown() method to update the focus view of the window on click.
If the view isn't attached to a window this method has no effect.

parameterdescription.para: true to set focus, false to remove it.

briefdescription.para: Return the scroll bar's maximum size.

simplesect.para: The maximum size of the scroll bar as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Return the scroll bar's minimum size.

simplesect.para: The minimum size of the scroll bar as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Returns the direction of the scroll bar.
Perform some action. (Internal Method)
Return the scroll bar's preferred size.

simplesect.para: The preferred size of the scroll bar as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Returns the ratio of the size of a scroll knob to the scroll bar.

simplesect.para: A value between 0.0 and 1.0 as a float.

detaileddescription.para: Resizes the view to its preferred size keeping the position of the left top corner constant.

simplesect.para: It is not recommended to use this method for views that are part of a BLayout.

briefdescription.para: Highlights or unhighlights the border of the scroll bar.

parameterdescription.para: true to turn highlighting on, false to remove it.

simplesect.para: If successful returns B_OK, otherwise, returns B_ERROR.

briefdescription.para: Sets the direction of the scroll view.

parameterdescription.para: Either B_HORIZONTAL or B_VERTICAL.

briefdescription.para: Set the ratio of the size of a scroll knob to the scroll bar.

simplesect.para: If value is outside the range 0.0 to 1.0 it is clipped to that range.

parameterdescription.para: a number between 0.0 and 1.0 that represents the proportion of the document that can be displayed within the target view.

briefdescription.para: Set the range of values that the scroll bar represents from min to max.

detaileddescription.para: These values should be calculated from the enclosing bounds of the target view. If min and max are both 0 the scroll bar is disabled and the knob is not drawn.
If the range changes such that the value is clipped SetValue() is called which triggers ValueChanged() to be triggered.

parameterdescription.para: The min value of the range, rounded to the nearest integer.
The max value of the range, rounded to the nearest integer.

briefdescription.para: Sets how far the scroll bar moves when it is scrolled.

simplesect.para: In BeOS R5, steps can be set only after the scroll bar is attached to a window, probably because the data is kept server-side, in Haiku this limitation has been removed.
The BeBook also says that we need to specify an integral value even though the step values are floats, in Haiku we round the values instead.

parameterdescription.para: The value to move the scroll bar under normal conditions.
The value to move the scroll bar taking a large step, this is usually triggered by holding down the Shift key while scrolling.

briefdescription.para: Sets the target view that the scroll bar operates on unsetting the previous target.

parameterdescription.para: The target view to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the target view to the view identified by targetName unsetting the previous target.

simplesect.para: The BeOS R5 implementation crashes for targetName == NULL and also does not modify the target if it can't be found.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the view to target.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value of the scroll bar scrolling the scroll thumb and target view accordingly.

detaileddescription.para: Setting the value programmatically using this method causes the ValueChanged() method to be called.
Derived classes can override this method to do something different than scrolling the target view.

parameterdescription.para: The value to set the scroll bar value to, rounded to the nearest integer.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the target view.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a BView object that represents the target view or NULL if the target is not set.

briefdescription.para: Returns the scroll bar's value.

simplesect.para: The scroll bar's value as a float.

briefdescription.para: User interface element used to scroll a target view vertically or horizontally.

detaileddescription.para: Scroll bars are usually added as siblings of the target view, that way when the parent is resized the target view and scroll bars can be resized as well. The BScrollView class conveniently provides such a container view adding the scroll bars and target view making itself the parent.

Scroll bars control the target view, but a target can also be scrolled independently by calling BView::ScrollTo() or BView::ScrollBy(). When a target view is set to a BScrollBar, the view is notified and stores a pointer to the BScrollBar object so that it can communicate its scroll information back to the scroll bar.
